intro: Artemisia godronii, commonly known as Godron's wormwood, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage composed of finely divided, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and rocky habitats. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal settings.
